an10.10:3.1: 10 Inspiring All Around: the Three Knowledges
an10.10:4.1: “A mendicant is faithful, but not ethical.
an10.10:4.2: So they’re incomplete in that respect,
an10.10:4.4: ‘How can I become faithful and ethical?’
an10.10:4.5: When the mendicant is faithful and ethical, they’re complete in that respect.
an10.10:5.1: A mendicant is faithful and ethical, but not learned … they’re not a Dharma speaker. …
an10.10:5.2: they don’t frequent assemblies … they don’t teach Dharma to the assembly with assurance … they’re not an expert in the training … they don’t recollect their many kinds of past lives …
an10.10:5.6: they don’t, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, see sentient beings passing away and being reborn …
an10.10:5.8: they don’t realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having achieved it with their own insight due to the end of defilements.
an10.10:5.10: So they’re incomplete in that respect,
an10.10:5.12: ‘How can I become faithful, ethical, and learned, a Dharma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dharma to the assembly with assurance, an expert in the training, one who recollects their many kinds of  past lives, one who with clairvoyance that surpasses the human sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn, and one who lives having realized the end of defilements?’
an10.10:6.1: When they are faithful, ethical, and learned, a Dharma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dharma to the assembly with assurance, an expert in the training, one who recollects their many kinds of past lives, one who with clairvoyance that surpasses the human sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn, and one who lives having realized the end of defilements,
an10.10:6.6: A mendicant who has these ten qualities is inspiring all around, and is complete in every aspect.”
